sen.e: He spent the latter part of his life in Takeo and in 1834 he became a pupil of Shuhan TAKASHIMA for the first time as the feudal lord in Japan to study Western gunnery and science and technology, while making a great impact on Naomasa NABESHIMA, the lord of the Saga Domain, thereby leading to the development of the advanced military and technical power of the Saga Domain in the end of the Edo period.

sen.e: Prior to Hidetatsu EGAWA, Nirayama Daikan of the bakufu, who focused on Shuhan TAKASHIMA, Shigeyoshi had deep exchanges with Shuhan TAKASHIMA, and 1835, he was presented with a Western gun (bronze mortar gun) that was run for the first time in Japan by Takashima.

sen.e: This bronze mortar gun is variable because it has the Dutch description indicating the name of Shuhan TAKASHIMA and that it was run for the first time in Japan in 1835 (according to the Dutch calendar).

sen.j: そして、この頃には、武雄領でも西洋式大砲の鋳造や試射が行われており、茂義は、我が国の封建領主の中で最も早く西洋の軍事技術の導入に成功した人物と位置付けられる。
sen.e: In those days, the Western guns were made and trial launches was conducted in Takeo, and Shigeyoshi was deemed to be the first person among the feudal lords of Japan who was successful in introducing the Western military techniques.

sen.j: この武雄領の軍事技術に佐賀藩が注目したのは、それから5年後の天保11年（1840年）に佐賀藩主鍋島直正が武雄兵の軍事演習を視閲したときであった。
sen.e: It was after five years in 1840 that the Saga Domain noticed the military techniques of Takeo, when Naomasa NABESHIMA, the lord of the Saga Domain, censored the military maneuvers of the soldiers in Takeo.

sen.j: 佐賀藩は、江戸幕府老中水野忠邦が西洋式砲術に興味を示しているのを敏感に察知して、天保13年（1842年）、武雄領の平山醇左衛門を砲術稽古及び大砲鋳造のために取り立てている。
sen.e: The Saga Domain was sensitively aware that Tadakuni MIZUNO, roju (member of shogun's council of elders) of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), was showing an interest in the western gunnery, and forced Junzaemon HIRAYAMA in Takeo to be caught for gunnery training and casting of guns in 1842.

sen.e: However, when Shuhan TAKASHIMA was arrested in the end of the year due to slander of Yozo TORII, who was a bakufu machi-bugyo (town magistrate), Junzaemon HIRAYAMA was executed in Takeo in the next year.

sen.e: In addition, in Takeo in the Tenpo era, glass products such as cylinders for science experiments and ceramics such as alembic (distilling equipment) and a mortar and pestle were manufactured at Tsukazaki-jo Castle (castle for the lord of Takeo; present-day Takeo High School).
